about_the_game:
PingViewer is a graphical ping displayer. At a glance, you can understand how stable and delayed your connection is.



Felt a stutter in your online session? Check the graph.

Features:

  • Intuitive color-coded interface, quick reads enabling quick awareness.
  • Hover any ping bar for a detailed readout and timestamp.
  • Pause & clear for focus & sampling.
  • Overlay any game or desktop environment by enabling "Pin PingViewer". (Fullscreen games running as administrator must be ran borderless or windowed)
  • Press "Mini Mode" on the left to switch to a more low-profile UI.
  • Customize color schemes, transparency, and scaling.
  • Configure IP destinations with presets of common DNS servers.

Convenient for:

  • Figuring out whether your ping is stable enough to enter a multiplayer match without headache.
  • Testing out different network configurations (router positions, ethernet cables).
  • Visualizing your ping for a livestream or just for yourself as an in-game overlay.
  • Showing it to your friends to excuse poor gameplay, as I have done so very many times.
detailed_description:
PingViewer is a graphical ping displayer. At a glance, you can understand how stable and delayed your connection is.



Felt a stutter in your online session? Check the graph.

Features:

  • Intuitive color-coded interface, quick reads enabling quick awareness.
  • Hover any ping bar for a detailed readout and timestamp.
  • Pause & clear for focus & sampling.
  • Overlay any game or desktop environment by enabling "Pin PingViewer". (Fullscreen games running as administrator must be ran borderless or windowed)
  • Press "Mini Mode" on the left to switch to a more low-profile UI.
  • Customize color schemes, transparency, and scaling.
  • Configure IP destinations with presets of common DNS servers.

Convenient for:

  • Figuring out whether your ping is stable enough to enter a multiplayer match without headache.
  • Testing out different network configurations (router positions, ethernet cables).
  • Visualizing your ping for a livestream or just for yourself as an in-game overlay.
  • Showing it to your friends to excuse poor gameplay, as I have done so very many times.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Post-2016 distribution
  • Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core Processor or Raspberry Pi 4
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics with full OpenGL 3.3 support (Intel HD Graphics 2500, AMD Radeon R5 Graphics)
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Requires iputils or iputils-ping package
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Post-2020 distribution
  • Processor: 3.5 GHz Quad Core Processor or Raspberry Pi 5
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 or AMD Radeon RX 460
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Requires iputils or iputils-ping package

name: PingViewer

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core Processor
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics with full OpenGL 3.3 support (Intel HD Graphics 2500, AMD Radeon R5 Graphics)
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 3.5 GHz Quad Core Processor
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 or AMD Radeon RX 460
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

short_description: PingViewer is a network visualization tool that displays real-time ping on a graph. At a glance, you can understand your current network stability for gaming.
supported_languages: English, Polish, Russian, German, Korean, Simplified Chinese
